sentences.english: A noblewoman holding the rank of viscount in her own right.
sentences.chinese: 本人擁有子爵權利的女子爵。

sentences.english: We reserve the right to claim damages.
sentences.chinese: 我們保留索賠損失的權利。

sentences.english: The law punishes people who invade the fights of others.
sentences.chinese: 法律懲罰侵犯他人權利的人。

sentences.english: He suggested them read at least one book on the legal rights.
sentences.chinese: 他建議他們至少閱讀一本關於法定權利的書。

sentences.english: When you emperor of Manchoukuo, what rights did you have?
sentences.chinese: 你在當滿洲國皇帝的期間，有什麼權利嗎？

sentences.english: Go down Center Street and my house is on your right .
sentences.chinese: 走中心街與我的房子是你的權利。

sentences.english: Additionally, the defendant may file a counter - claim (or cross- claim) to assert the defendant's own claims against the plaintiff.
sentences.chinese: 另外，被告可以遞交反訴狀來向原告主張自己的權利。

sentences.english: You also understand that people murder for money or power ?
sentences.chinese: 你也知道人們爲了金錢或者權利殺人嗎？

sentences.english: Although issuer gets right gold, need to assume the market to turn over aweather danger however.
sentences.chinese: 發行者雖然收到權利金，卻需要承擔市場反向風險。

sentences.english: The Organisers reserve the right to amend the Schedule of Races should circumstances require.
sentences.chinese: 如有需要，本會將保留修改賽程表之權利。

sentences.english: Up on completion all rights go over to me.
sentences.chinese: 上完成的一切權利去給我。

sentences.english: We outrage at the sinful violation of the poeple's interests and rights.
sentences.chinese: 我們對侵犯人民利益和權利的罪惡行經表示強烈憤慨。

sentences.english: " You've got no right to talk to me like that, " Jesse said.
sentences.chinese: “你沒有權利這樣跟我說話”傑希說。

sentences.english: We are also an animal-friendly company.
sentences.chinese: 天然富源也是一家尊重動物權利的公司。

sentences.english: 《Principle of Statute Philosophy》 is about the philosophy of rights.
sentences.chinese: 《法哲學原理》是關於權利的哲學。

sentences.english: It belongs to the scope of personal liberty and is some.
sentences.chinese: 人身自由是公民全部權利中最基礎的和前提性的部分。

definition: to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
